author: Aayush Arya
comment: I would give it five stars if it offered any way at all to record a tiny description of what the expense is for and automatically saved the location and time the transaction was made at. Without these crucial bits of data, it's practically useless as an expense tracker. I can never remember what the money was spent for when I look at a contextually deficient list of amounts and dates a few days later.

author: Jiewa - INIJIE.com
comment: Neat UI and pretty straightforward functionality. I'll give five stars if I can modify the currency and seperator.
title: Useful but can be improved

author: Brian Duncan
comment: I need a daily sales tracker on my wear and this does the trick. Voice activated a MAJOR WIN. Few suggestions: 1. change colors (yuck green) 2. Delete history option on wear itself. 3. Allow budgets for day, week, etc...
title: Best simple budget app EVER!!!

author: Chandra Shekar
comment: If there can be an option to have notification alerts at specified usage levels (like 90%), the app would be a lot more useful. Also, if there's a persistent notification that can be accessed to bring up the expense calculator, it would make the logging task simpler and would improve its relevance. In addition, the UI seems too simple; might lead users to believe that its functionality/utility is limited
title: Good, but can be better

author: Jared Cooperband
comment: Would also like to choose weekly or biweekly budgets.  App does not look good when watch is in enlarged text mode. Will rate 5 stars if changed
title: Additional features

author: Dennis Gilmore
comment: Not being able to at the least put in a description of what you spent the money on makes it impossible to be able to figure out what you're spending money on. If all you want to know is how much you have spent then it's okay.
title: Simple interface but lacking in detail

author: Dave Crick
comment: Going forward it need some categories, preferably user defined. It will then be perfect for my use!
title: Definitely good

author: Hilton Tiam-Lee
comment: Really wish the number pad supported round screens.

reply.author: bestan
reply.content:
Hi Hilton,

I've just updated the app and significantly improved support for the round screens! Let me know what you think :)

title: Nice and simple!

reply.author: bestan
reply.content:
Hi Raj,

I have just improved support for the round screens. Let me know what you think!

author: James Frary
comment: Would be great if you could see the remaining balance. Not just what you have spent.
title: Just the start

author: Arman Attarzadeh
comment: I have been looking for an app like this for a while and this fits the bill. Quite simple and easy to use and understand. Just a few quirks. The UI is not optimized for round watches like my Moto360. Hope that gets fixed because the number pad is pretty useless right now. Also, it would be great to change the currency used (not a big issue). Overall good app.

reply.author: bestan
reply.content: Thanks for the review! I've updated UI on moto360, so check it out!

title: Good app but needs a few fixes

author: Carlos Medina
comment: It works all right and does the job,  but the entering expenses screen is cut off on my Moto360.  I can't see the first 1-2 numbers or the Enter button. Please,  do let me know if you manage to get it to conform .

reply.author: bestan
reply.content: Thanks for the review. I've just published a new version which hopefully would fix the issue, but not having Moto360 and having inconsistencies in Android Wear SDK makes it quite tricky. Could you please email me and let me know how it goes? Really want to fix this issue for you and several other users. Thanks!

title: Works,  and is useful,  but needs "rounding "

author: Chandler Anderson
comment: I asked r/AndroidWear if there was a solution like this for tracking cash expenses on-the-fly, and they referred me to yours. It works great so far! It'd be cool to see some sort of labeling (via voice or other input method) or geotagging for the expenses, but that'd just be a bonus for me since the app does all the basics of what I was looking for. Good work!
title: Glad there's an app for this!

author: Roberto Ruisánchez Mazo
comment: I only miss the possibility to select a concept for the expenses. Very good app.
title: Concept

author: Himiko Neko
comment: UPDATE: Everything works fine!!! Thanks a lot.  :) Hi, I am very glad that you decide to add number pad. But from my watch I only can see   1   2   3 4   5   6 7   8   9  Judging from your screenshot, the bottom line is missing. My watch is LG  G Watch.  Can you fix this please?

reply.author: bestan
reply.content:
UPDATE: Just published a fix. It should be in the Play Store very soon.


Thanks for pointing out an important feature. I completely agree that voice recognition doesn't always work, so I've just published an update with the number pad in the wear app! Let me know what you think.

title: number pad

author: Jim Thibault
comment: The command "start expenses tracker" for me is hit and miss. Maybe something like "start expenses" ..... it works but not all the time.  Left an idea in XDA,  May have the ability to create more than one list, Vacation, Work, Coffee, ... etc.

reply.author: bestan
reply.content: Thanks for the feedback. I actually tried "start expenses" and couple of other shorter names, but for some reason Google's voice recognition didn't link it with the app and opened just a Google search instead. Longer names worked better, but I will definitely research this further. Thanks!

title: Good Idea

author: E C
comment: Please fix UI for Moto360 circular screen!

reply.author: bestan
reply.content: Check out the latest version - UI should be much better on Moto360 now!

title: Please fix UI
